tasks

Class TaskMandelbrotSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • tasks.TaskMandelbrotSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Task<java.lang.Integer[][]>, java.io.Serializable

    public class TaskMandelbrotSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements Task<java.lang.Integer[][]>, java.io.Serializable
    This is a class that implements the Task.java interface so that it may be run by classes that implement the Computer interface. The TaskMandelBrotSet takes in parameters that specify a square in the complex bumber plane. It will return a 2x2 matrix representing the iteration limits for the mandelbrot set in order to aid with visualization. For more information see execute()
    Author:
    EthanPreble & GregParsons
    See Also:
    http://www.cs.ucsb.edu/~cappello/290B/homework/1/, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TaskMandelbrotSet

        public TaskMandelbrotSet(double lower_left_x,
                 double lower_left_y,
                 double edge_length,
                 int n_pixels,
                 int iteration_limit)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        double - for lower left x square coordinate for a square in the complex plane x represents real number axis
        double - for lower left y square coordinate for a square in the complex plane y represents imaginary number axis
        double - for edge length of the square.
        int - for the number of subsquares where the square region will be divided into nXn squares where n is the parameter.
        int - for the iteration limit, ie the numebr of times that the iterative calculation will be performed

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.lang.Integer[][] execute()
        Execute the constructed Mandelbrot task. The execute method returns an Integer[n][n] count array, where count[i][j] = k, where |zk| > 2 or k is the iteration limit (whichever is smaller), where z0 = c, where c is the representative point in square[i][j] (typically the lower left point defining the square) zk = (zk-1)2 + c.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Task<java.lang.Integer[][]>
